H0.text: Topographic maps reveal the shape of a landscape.

H1.text: Meteorological maps reveal the shape of a landscape.

H2.text: Geologic maps reveal the shape of a landscape.

H3.text: Geographic maps reveal the shape of a landscape.

A4.text: These maps depict in detail ground relief (landforms and terrain), drainage (lakes and rivers), forest cover, administrative areas, populated areas, transportation routes and facilities (including roads and railways), and other man-made features.

A5.text: Topographic maps conventionally show topography, or land contours, by means of contour lines. Contour lines are curves that connect contiguous points of the same altitude (isohypse).
